III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107 Employment policies and procedures;
Section establishment
Description (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment
policies and procedures that shall assure staff are
1

emotionally stable and of suitable health, ability, experience,
and education to perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff allegedly made sexual advances towards youth and either
touched the youth or attempted to touch the youth. Staff told youth
she could move in with him.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 7/16/25. No
additional information was provided.
The following interviews were conducted face to face in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker at the facility on 7/16/25:
Administrator reported they received a grievance from Youth A
concerning Staff 1. The allegations did not involve sexual touching
only that Staff 1 was verbally inappropriate towards Youth A.
Administrator reported Clinical Director reviewed the grievance
and completed her process. Administrator reported Youth A has a
history of being sexually promiscuous and making allegations the
staff are all pedophiles. Administrator reported Staff 1 does not
usually work with Youth A as he is a floater and would only cover
a pod if they needed assistance. They reviewed video footage of
the interactions Youth A might have had with Staff 1 and Staff 1
was never near her or displayed any sexual advances.
Clinical Director reported she received a grievance June 30,
2025, from Youth A. The grievance noted that Staff 1 had stated
“inappropriate things” to her and that he had asked her to move in
with him. The inappropriate comment Youth A stated was after her
shower. She stated Staff 1 asked her, “Did you clean up the
shower knowing what you did in there?” Clinical Director said
there was never allegation of Youth A being touched by Staff 1.
Clinical Director reported Youth A was on wing restriction during
this time. This meant Youth A would have been in her room and
one staff sitting outside of her room. Clinical Director reported
Staff 1 is a floater so he might come in and check on her. Clinical
Director reported that when Youth A gets upset, she tends to
make up stories to get others into trouble. Clinical Director
reported Youth A tends to write grievances just so she can talk to
someone. Clinical Director reported Youth A has called male staff
pedophiles when she gets upset. Clinical Director reported she
reviewed camera footage on or around 6/30/25 and there was
nothing on the camera to validate Youth A’s allegations. Clinical
Director reported she talked to Staff 1, and he denied the
2

allegations. Clinical Director reported they received another
grievance from Youth B on 7/3/25 stating the same things as
Youth A. Clinical Director reported she never got to interview
Youth B because they terminated Staff 1 on 7/5/25 due to an
incident report they received stating Staff 1 gave out personal
information concerning Staff 2.
Supervisor reported he supervises Staff 1. Supervisor reported
Staff 1 had some boundary issues with youth. These were
described as Staff 1 acting more of a friend at times than staff and
failing to provide structure. Supervisor preferred Staff 1 being a
floater instead of full time staff in a unit. Supervisor reported
because of Staff 1’s lack of structure with the group he had not
received a permanent spot in a group yet.
Administrator, Clinical Director, and Supervisor all reported
when they received the allegations, they didn’t allow Staff 1 to be
on the pod with Youth A. All three reported that on 7/5/25 they
received an incident report that a male youth knew too much
personal information about Staff 1 and Staff 2, alleging Staff 1 told
personal information to the youth. Due to this, the previous
concerns of lack of structure, and the grievance, they terminated
Staff 1.
On 7/23/25 the following interviews were conducted face to face in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker at the facility.
Youth A reported Staff 1 is a float staff. Youth A reported Staff 1
has never been their group staff and she has never been alone
with Staff 1. Youth A reported she was in the gym playing
basketball with Youth B and Staff 1 came over and wiped his
forehead and said, “that looks like lube.” Youth A reported he
never explained what he meant, but she thought he was referring
to lubrication you use for sexual gratification. Youth A reported
another time she was showering, and Staff 1 said to her, “Make
sure you clean up - don’t want anyone else to slip and fall.” Youth
A reported she thinks Staff 1 was implying Youth A was
masturbating, and someone would slip due to this, but Staff 1
never explained what he meant. Youth A reported Staff 1 gave his
Instagram account information to her. The account was
“DCmarvel.” Youth A gave us her Instagram and stated she was
friends with him. Her account was “duh_unwanted.” Youth A
reported she also gave Staff 1 her girlfriend’s Instagram which
was “mera_essence”. Youth A reported Staff 1 stated he would
“give her a joint” when she gets out and she could come live with
him when she leaves. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 had a
3

relationship and one day Youth A told Staff 2 about the
conversation she had with Staff 1, and it made Staff 2 cry. When
Staff 2 started crying she questioned Staff 2, “Why are you
upset?” Youth A reported Staff 2 left the unit and another staff
filled in. Youth A reported she didn’t mind the conversations with
Staff 1 but then felt like it was getting weird, so she filed a
grievance. Youth A reported Staff 1 never touched her or
attempted to touch her. Youth A reported she has called staff
“perverts and pedophiles” when she is upset with them. Youth A
reported she did not know Staff 1’s address or phone number.
Youth B reported Staff 1 had an inappropriate conversation with
her a “week or two ago.” Youth B reported Staff 1 is usually a
floater. Youth B reported she went up to him and said, “What’s the
word? I heard you said Youth A can move in with you?” Youth B
reported he told her she could move in too. Youth B couldn’t
provide any details about who else was around or where this took
place. Youth B reported they had another conversation where
Youth A and Staff 1 were together and Staff 1 asked, “What are
your types?”, which Youth B said meant “what type of guys you
like?”. She reported Staff 1 had asked them how many guys they
slept with. Youth B reported he had told them about his girlfriend
and discussed his sexual experience with her. Youth B reported
she had played cards with him one day and he asked for her
Instagram information and she gave it to him. Her Instagram
account was “EBK._slime_da_city.” Youth B reported Staff 1 only
talked about these things in private with them. Youth B reported
he never touched or attempted to touch her. Youth B reported she
does not know Staff 1’s phone number or address. Youth B
reported she didn’t file a grievance until after Youth A filed hers
because she wanted to support her.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker on 8/5/25. Staff 2 reported she wrote an
incident report on 7/3/25 noting Youth A and Youth B spoke to her
and stated Staff 1 had made inappropriate comments towards
them, making them uncomfortable. They alleged he exchanged
social media information, told them they could live with him, and
discussed sexual comments about “lube.” Staff 2 did not hear
these comments from Staff 1. Staff 2 admitted she was upset with
the things the youth were saying because they kept “poking” at
her by stating Staff 1 also told the boy units Staff 1 and Staff 2
were in a relationship and Staff 2 doesn’t wear any underwear.
Staff 2 reported she was friends with Staff 1, and she hung out
with him after work. Staff 2 was adamant she did not have a
romantic relationship with him. Staff 2 reported she had to leave
4

the unit due to the things Youth A and Youth B were saying
because it upset her. Staff 2 reported she had never heard Staff 1
speak inappropriately with any youth but said Staff 1 was more of
a friend than staff and allowed personal conversation to be
discussed. Staff 2 reported the conversations she heard were
never sexual in nature or to the level that she would let
administration know.
On 8/20/25, I attended a telephone interview with Staff 1. Staff 1
agreed to meet with DHHS Worker in the community. Staff 1 did
not have a residence and was living in his car. Staff 1 reported he
was terminated from his position at the facility. Staff 1 was not
completely sure why he was terminated but they had told him
there were “several violations.” Staff 1 reported he was a floater
mostly on the boys’ unit. He would sometimes complete “wing
restrictions” where a youth would be placed in their room and he
would sit on the outside supervising. Staff 1 reported he knew a
grievance was filed on him by Youth A for making a shower
comment about a mop. Staff 1 reported he has everyone mop up
after showers because the youth pee in the showers. Staff 1
reported he never had 1 on 1 conversations with Youth A or Youth
B. Staff 1 reported Youth B never had a conversation with him
personally. Staff 1 reported she would just come around the table
where he would be when playing chess, but that was it. Staff 1
reported he had “life conversations” with the youth. They (youth in
general) would talk to him about their life outside of the facility and
what they are going to do when they leave. Staff 1 reported Youth
A talked about where she was going to live when she left the
facility, which was at her girlfriend’s. Staff 1 reported Youth A
would talk in a sexual nature about her girlfriend and another
woman. Staff 1 reported he would not engage in that
conversation, but he also didn’t stop it. Staff 1 reported Youth A
wanted him to use his Instagram account to send a message to
her girlfriend. Staff 1 reported he did not do that. Staff 1 reported
he never received Youth A or Youth B’s Instagram account or
gave out his. Staff 1 reported he has played basketball in the gym
with the youth but never talked about “lube” with any youth. Staff 1
reported he was in a relationship with Staff 2, and it was romantic.
Staff 1 reported the boys asked him if Staff 2 wore underwear and
he would not engage with the conversation. Staff 1 reported he
didn’t engage in the conversations the youth had but allowed them
to talk. When they were done, he would change the topic.
The following youth were interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/20/25 by me:
5

Youth C, Youth D, Youth E, and Youth F all reported they have
been staffed by Staff 1. All reported they have never heard Staff 1
state inappropriate sexual comments to them or to the females on
the unit. All reported he was never alone with females on the unit.
All reported they never saw him close or touching females on the
unit. None of the youth knew where he lived or what his phone
number was nor his Instagram account.
Youth C and Youth D reported they could talk to Staff 1 about their
lives, and he would listen.
Video Observation:
The grievance was filed on 6/30/25 by Youth A. Due to Youth B
reporting the conversations happened about a “week or two ago” I
reviewed the schedule for Staff 1 in the month of June. He was
only scheduled on 6/27/25 and 6/29/25 with Youth A and Youth
B’s pod; therefore, these dates were watched. Staff 1’s shifts were
from 2:30pm-10:30pm. It should be noted the video does not have
audio.
6/27/25: Staff 1 never interacted with Youth A or Youth B. Youth A
was in wing restriction and he was not the staff supervising her.
6/29/25: Staff 1 is seen playing cards with Youth D at the table in
the unit and both Youth A and Youth B are not near them or
engaged in any type of conversation with them. At 7:37pm, Staff 1
is in the gym with the unit and playing basketball. He sits down at
a table and Youth A and Youth B sit on both sides of him. Staff 1
is never seen wiping his forehead and showing them anything on
his hands. Staff 1 sits on the sidelines while the group is playing
basketball. He sits there until 7:50pm and gets up. Youth B leaves
and then Staff 1 and Youth A are standing there until 8:13pm.
During this time, they are engaged in a conversation. Staff 1 is at
an acceptable distance from them and there are no sexual
gestures seen. After this there is no other interaction until 9:30pm.
Youth A comes out of the bathroom, Staff 1 and Youth A
exchange words quickly and she goes back into the bathroom.
That was the last interaction Staff 1 had with Youth A.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Youth A’s face sheet. Youth A was placed on 6/16/25.
• Youth B’s face sheet. Youth B was placed at the facility
on 6/8/25.
6

• Youth A’s grievance signed on 6/3025, received by
Clinical Director on 7/4/25.
[Staff 1] has had a lot of inappropriate conversations with
me mainly all sexual he also stated to me and I quote
“when you leave out of here, you’ll be 18 and you could
come live with me.” He also said to me, “did you clean the
floor up someone might slip known what you do in there.”
He said this, because of an earlier conversation where I
stated [the shower] has two shower heads one up top and
the bottom. I also stated that’s the only place I’m a do some
sexual at.”
• Incident Report: Youth B did not file a grievance, but Staff
2 wrote the Incident report dated 7/3/25, when both Youth
A and Youth B sat down with her during her shift and both
explained Staff 1’s behaviors. The Incident report noted
Staff 1 had made inappropriate comments towards them,
making them uncomfortable. He exchanged social media
information, told them they could live with him, and
discussed sexual comments about “lube.”
• Personal Boundaries Policy. The policy states that all
employees are to maintain professional boundaries.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: All criminal clearances were up to
date with the last one completed on 10/23/24. Training was
up to date and Staff 1’s most recent boundary training was
completed on 10/24/24. Staff 1 resigned on 7/12/25.
• Instagram accounts were looked up and none of the
accounts were following each other.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Staff schedule, video
observation, and interviews with Supervisor and multiple youth
reveal Staff 1 physically had boundaries with Youth A and Youth
B. Multiple youth interviewed never noted Staff 1 as having
inappropriate conversations and reported he was never alone with
female youth.
Video observation does not provide many interactions with the
youth. Only during the basketball game is Staff 1 seen sitting near
the youth, but there is no audio to determine if there were
inappropriate conversations and both Youth A and Youth B did not
report the conversations happening in the gym. Staff 1 is not seen
wiping his forehead and showing Youth A and Youth B anything
on his hands.
7

Staff 1 denied stating he asked the youth to move in with him and
no other youth or staff witnessed this.
Technical Assistance:
Staff 1 admitted he allowed Youth A to talk about her girlfriend. He
admitted he thought it was inappropriate and waited for her to be
finished and then redirected the conversation. These actions allow
youth to think staff are engaged in the conversation and this type
of conversation is appropriate. It would benefit the agency to
discuss how to stop inappropriate conversations youth initiate and
how to ensure the youth know those topics are not appropriate. If
inappropriate conversations are initiated and labeled as such,
there should be logging of the conversations so that all staff are
aware and ready to label it as inappropriate if the youth continue
with them in the future.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the investigative findings the facility is compliant with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
